data.question: What are the two substrates introduced into the crystals of networked M6L4 cages?
What was the observed chemoselectivity in the reaction within the M6L4 cages?
data.answer: Chemoselective acylation of 4-hydroxydiphenylamine at the less nucleophilic OH group

data.question: How was the first substrate introduced into the network crystals?
data.answer: By soaking the crystals of network 1 in a saturated toluene solution of substrate 3

data.question: What method was used to introduce the second substrate into the crystal?
data.answer: By immersing the crystals of 1⊃3 in a decane solution containing a large excess of substrate 4

data.question: What was the result of the bimolecular reaction in the network crystals?
data.answer: Formation of O-acylated and N,O-diacylated compounds 6 and 7 in yields of 38 and 55%, respectively

data.question: What was the unique feature of the networked M6L4 cages that facilitated the bimolecular reaction?
data.answer: The strong host–guest interactions in the cages control the substrate geometry in the crystal, resulting in high reaction selectivities

data.question: Why was the N site of substrate 3 protected in the M6L4 cages?
data.answer: Because the NH group of substrate 3 is effectively protected by tight packing within the cage units

data.question: How did the researchers confirm the inhibition of N-acylation by the cage?
data.answer: Through a control experiment with discrete Pd6L4 cage 2 in solution

data.question: What was the purpose of tracing the product ratio during the reaction?
data.answer: To understand the unusual chemoselectivity by observing the formation of N-acylated product 5 as an intermediate

data.question: What did the product distribution reveal about the reaction pathways?
data.answer: There are two competing reaction pathways: N-acylation followed by O-acylation and O-acylation without further reaction

data.question: True or False: The crystallinity of network 1 remained intact throughout the reaction.
True or False: The inclusion of substrate 3 into the cages occurred in a single-crystal-to-single-crystal fashion.
True or False: The acylation reaction did not result in the formation of N-acylated product 5 in the crystal.
True or False: The guest inclusion occurred without any disorder of the guests within the cage.
True or False: The environment of substrate 3 in the M6L4 cages is the same as in the interstitial pores.
True or False: The observed chemoselectivity is inconsistent with that exhibited by discrete M6L4 cage 2 in solution.
True or False: The inclusion complex was formulated as [(Co(NCS)2)3(TPT)4(3)m·(solvent)]n with m = 8-9.
